text: So, hello everyone, I again welcome you all to the course on fuzzy logic inference and machine learning techniques. I am Dr. Aftab Ahmed Ansari, your instructor for this course. Basically, this is our lecture number 10. So, if you will see the recap of the previous class, what we have covered in our previous class. So, we have in the previous class, we have seen about the Mamdani fuzzy inference system and their basically in their structure, how we will write the rules in the case of Mamdani fuzzy inference system that is if then rules structure we have seen in the previous class and we have also seen about the component of the Mamdani fuzzy inference system that is a fuzzification then rule base and inference engine then the diversification method we have seen and after evaluating all the rules, how we will generate the output with the help of T-norm and S-norm. T-norm means and operation and S-norm means or operation with the help of that how we will generate our output with the help of graphically we have also seen in the previous class and we have solved also one complete numerical on the Mamdani numerical Mamdani inference system basically indirectly at that time when we are solving the numerical I have not told you that I am using the Mamdani, but that is basically the example which is completely based on the Mamdani inference system. Now in this class we will learn about the Sugino interference method that is next most popular inference method in the fuzzy logic controller now in this class we will try to understand that Sugino interference method basically so that Sugino inference method is introduced by the Takagi Sugino and Kang they have introduced the Sugino inference method it is that method is also known as the TSK basically Takagi Sugino Kang model and it is now what is the difference between in the Mamdani and Sugino inference method that is basically the output of the main excluding output all the steps are same and the root evolution is also different in the Sugino, but if I will broadly if I will give you the difference between Mamdani and fuzzy is that it is output basically in the case in the case of Mamdani inference method you will get the output in the form of fuzzy set then you have to apply the fuzzy method to convert that output to the crisp output, but in the case of Sugino inference method you will get directly the output in the form of crisp output you now in this method you do not have to use the fuzzy any fuzzy method to convert that output to the crisp output because in this method directly you will get the crisp output that is major difference that is major difference between basically in Mamdani and Sugino inference system. So, that type of method basically that Sugino inference method we can use in the system where adaptive systems are there or when we are applying the optimization technique in any control application. So, in that type of system we will apply our Sugino inference method with the help of that fuzzy logic controller. So, that fuzzy that is a fuzzy inference system that produce the crisp output directly from the weighted rules after the rule liberation it will directly give the you the crisp output you do not have to convert the output to the again to the crisp output basically that is the most important advantage of the Sugino inference method as compared to the Mamdani ok. Now, that the comparison table in between that in the if we will see if we will see consequent term is the input term then it is fuzzy set and in this also the output the output which you are giving for the output also basically antecedent means your input conditions and the consequent means your output condition. So, in the case of Mamdani you will you have to also define the fuzzy set for the output also like in the previous class if you will see the numerical which we have solved we have we are in that numerical we are controlling the fan speed with the help of giving two inputs that is a temperature and humidity and our output is fan speed. Now, for the temperature also we have defined 3 membership functions for the humidity also we have defined 3 membership function and for the output also we have we have defined the 3 membership functions, but in the case of Sugino you have to define the membership function for the input not for the output means your output will be in the form of a mathematical function that is if your output is z then it will then it will be in the form of ax plus by plus c it is in the form of mathematical equations. Now, defuzzification method required in the case of Mamdani method, but in the case of Sugino method it is not required that is the second difference. Now, it is output is direct in the case of Mamdani you have to convert that fuzzy output to the crisp output with the help of defuzzification, but in the case of Sugino method you will directly get the crisp output you do not have to use any defuzzification method. And the computation it is basically in the case of Mamdani system you can see it is a more complex system as compared to the Sugino like the numerical which we have solved first we have to match our input to the crisp to the fuzzy input then we have to see which rule is which rule is activated according to that input then we have to aggregate all the rules and then after aggregating we have to again we have to again defuzzify to get the crisp output it becomes a more little bit more complex as compared to the Sugino method and so that is why we can see that it is more efficient as compared to the Mamdani method. Now, if we will see about the application area then it can be it can be used in the human understandable control and the Sugino method we can use in the application area of optimization at the adaptive system types of types of application where we can use. Now, if you will see graphically the comparison between Mamdani and Sugino. So, input like I have for the Mamdani I have taken the 3 inputs now first according to the diagram you can see that that conditions are same means that that that steps you have to follow also in the Sugino method as you have followed in the Mamdani, but the last step is different from Mamdani and Sugino Mamdani you have to whatever fuzzy output you you will get you have to convert that into the defuzzification method you have to convert it in the crisp output, but in the case of Sugino after aggregating basically in this case not aggregating in the weighted average after weighted average you will directly get the crisp output. Here you get the fuzzy output and you have to convert that fuzzy output to the crisp output with the help of some defuzzification method you have to apply. So, that is a difference between the Mamdani and Sugino now come now again we come to the Sugino inference method it will map our crisp point again some steps are same as the as in the Mamdani method first you have to map your crisp input to the crisp output with the help of some fuzzy rules and then the key steps are again also some key steps are also again common as same in the Mamdani's term first one is the fuzzification method second one is the rule evolution then third one is the inference engine now that inference engine is Sugino for that case now in the case of Mamdani fourth step is the aggregation and defuzzification the fifth step we can see that in the case of Mamdani, Sugino inference method after inference engine after the rule evolution you will get you will go for the weighted average and that output of the weighted average is your crisp output final output basically you do not have to go for the again for the next step basically. So, output is here our output is the weighted combination of the rule output which is typically basically a linear functions. So, it is basically computationally efficient as compared to the Mamdani inference system that is why that it is mostly suitable for the optimizations types of control system. Now that is the that is the complete rule format if x is a and y is b then z is a x plus b y plus c any linear function I am taking or another rule if you will made if x is b and y is c then z is c directly constant you also can give both answer you can take from the Sugino as a linear if you want you can take the linear output if you want the any constant output you can also take the constant output from the Sugino inference engine. Now again I am taken I have taken one numerical for the better understanding about the how SUGI system will work. So we have to design a SUGI type of the controller for an air conditioner we have to design I have taken an example for air conditioner now whatever input again the same input I have taken for this numerical also that is temperature and degree Celsius and humidity and percentage I have taken as a input and our output should be fan speed when what is the fan speed for that air conditioner according to that input.
